intro: Erythranthe parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered erythranthe, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are basal and pinnately lobed, while the flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters. Erythranthe parviflora is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in cool, temperate climates.
